result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Barrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF413 & 14CM363 called together at 10:39 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC & FSSC)
Defendant Robert L. Barrett in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-14CM363 & Count #1-14CF413; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2-14CM363

On Count #1-14CM363 & Count #1-14CF413, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment within 90 days of sentencing & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs without a valid prescription
--To maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No acts/threats of violence to any person
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--Statutory court costs on each case
--DNA Surcharge on each case
--To pay domestic abuse surcharge (14CM363)
--To pay $25 drug testing fee (14CF413)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (14CF413)

15CF413 - 6 month suspension of driving privileges
Days credit for time already served: 22 days (14CF413)
Days credit for time already served: 3 days (14CM363)
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 11:03 am
Scheduling Notice

Cases 14CF413 and 14CM363 called together at 1:31pm [mo]
Defendant Robert L. Barrett in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 14CF413:  
Mr. Barrett waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial & Arraignment.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

As to 14CM363:
Atty. Huebner indicates that the Defense does not dispute the competency report
Atty. Huebner withdraws the NGI plea previously entered and requests that this case have a Status with the FSSC in the CF case
--No objection from ADA Beck 
The Court indicates that the NGI is withdrawn and the previously entered 'not guilty' plea remains 
recess: 1:35pm 

NEXT:   (1) Status Conference for Case 14CM363 & FSSC for 14CF413: 9/8/15 at 10:30am (2) Jury Trial for 14CF413: 9/14/15 at 8:30am
Scheduling order
Jury trial at 09-14-2015 08:30 am
Final status/scheduling conference at 09-08-2015 10:30 am
Waiver of Prelim at 07-30-2015 01:15 pm
Scheduling Notice

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] cases #14CF413 and #14CM363 called at 2:37pm. 
Defendant Robert L. Barrett in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner indicates that the Case #14CF413 should be scheduled for Jury Trial. 
As to Case #14CM363, Attorney Huebner enters a dual plea, adding an NGI Plea to the already-entered Not Guilty Plea. 
In Case #14CM363 the Court orders an examination, appointing Dr. James Freiburger to conduct the criminal responsibility examination. The Court requires Dr.Freiburger to file his report within 30 days. 
The Court instructs Mr. Barrett to cooperate with the examiner. 
Attorney Huebner confirms that the Defense is waiving speedy trial in these cases. 
Mr. Barrett verifes that the 378 East Church Street, Jefferson address remains current. 
The Court continues Bond, reminding Mr. Barrett to follow the conditions of Bond.
recess 2:41pm. 

NEXT:  (1) clerk to prepare examination order in Case #14CM363, (2) in Case #14CM363- a Status Conference on 7/30/15 at 1:15pm, (3) in Case #14CF413- FSSC on 9/8/15 at 10:30am and Jury Trial on 9/14/15 at 8:30am 

[Clerk's added note:  in reviewing Case #14CF413 post-hearing, it is realized that Case #14CF413 is still at Prelim-stage. There is a Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver in the file, however that has not been accepted by the Court to date. Therefore Case #14CF413 needs to be scheduled for Preliminary Hearing or for Waiver of Prelim, as the Court deems appropriate.  MK]
Pre-trial conference at 06-17-2015 01:40 pm
Status conference at 06-26-2015 02:30 pm
Pre-trial conference at 06-17-2015 01:40 pm
Scheduling Notice

records.addlTxt:
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Cases 14CF413 and 14CM363 called together at 3:14pm [mo]
Defendant Robert L. Barrett in court, in custody with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
[off-record/prior to case being called: Attorney Huebner updates Mr. Barrett's address effective 5/29/2015 to East Church St., Jefferson]
The Court verifies receipt of the Competency Report
ADA Teuber and Atty. Huebner verify receipt of the Competency Report
---no corrections or objections to the report
The Court and Counsel discuss competency status
Mr. Barrett claims to be competent
The Court finds Mr. Barrett to be competent.
The Court lifts any previous stay/ pause of this case
Atty. Huebner requests a Pretrial and Status Conference
Counsel waives times limits as to Preliminary Hearing
The Court and Counsel discuss the custodial status of Mr. Barrett; Atty. Huebner indicates that Mr. Barrett has been transported here, that he is custody now but has a signature bond and should be released at end of hearing.
The Court prosposes reinstating bond as previously set
No objection from the State
The Court will continue bail as previously fixed.
recess:3:20pm

NEXT: (1) PreTrial Conference: June 17, 2015 at 1:40pm (2) Status Conference: June 26, 2015 at 2:30pm [Send Notices]

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF413 & 14CM363 called together at 9:15 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Robert L. Barrett in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel inform the Court that they are in agreement with report
Mr. Barrett informs the Court that agrees with report
Court finds that Mr. Barrett is not competent to proceed at this time, but with treatment is likely to become competent within the statutory guidelines. Court orders commitment for treatment & recommends but does not require treatment through OCRP. Court suspends proceedings.
Recess: 9:21 am
Competency hearing on March 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling notice
Order for Exam

Cases #14CF413 & 14CM363 called at 10:04a.m.[MO & MK]
Defendant Robert L. Barrett in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner explains that defendent Robert Barrett suffered head trauma injuries as part of the June 2014 motorcycle accident related to 14CF413. The defense is now questioning whether these head trauma issues may have been impacting Mr. Barrett when the events in case 14CM363 occured. The defense is requesting a dual plea so that a NGI plea is added to the previously entered not guilty plea.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. Attorney Huebner indicates that Mr. Barrett will waive his right to preliminary hearing in case 14CF413 today.
Recess:10:10, recovene 10:14
The Court reviews with Mr. Barrett the Waiver of Preliminary Hearing form that the defense has submitted. Mr. Barrett at first says he understands the form for the most part, and then goes on to say that he does not understand many things because of his traumatic brain injury.
Attorney Huebner compentency concerns.
The Court orders a compentency examination to be conducted on an outpatient basis.
The Court reminds Mr. Barrett that the bond and conditions of bond continue.
recess: 10:19am

NEXT: Competency Hearing: 3/19/2015 at 9:00am.
Status conference on February 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Court finds that RFS is timely & in proper form. Court directs Clerk to request the assignment of another Judge under Wis. Stat. 971.20(8)

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

cases #14CM363 and #14CF413 called at 9:06am [MK]
Defendant Robert L. Barrett in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

In Case #14CF413 Initial Appearance is conducted: 
---Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
---Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
---The Court requires a $750 Signature Bond, with special condition: to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking

The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.  
recess  9:10am.

Attorney Karl Huebner
